title: (x) text font with protruding serifs - Ronaldson Old Style {David H}
content:
I’ve met this in many old books, printed in Romania. The uppercase protruding serifs make this font easy to spot. Any ideas ?

(samples below are from a ’60 book)

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [cousteau-1.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20071222005038/http:/typophile.com/files/cousteau-1.jpg) | 100.63 KB |
| [cousteau-2.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20071222005038/http:/typophile.com/files/cousteau-2.jpg) | 57.98 KB |

 [‹ slab serif close to Aachen](http://web.archive.org/web/20071222005038/http:/typophile.com/node/19775 "Go to previous forum topic") [looking for WDW font ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20071222005038/http:/typophile.com/node/19733 "Go to next forum topic")
author: cromy

comments.content:
Great. No samples found on the net, but from descriptions, this is it.  
Thank you.

Rebecca Alaccari of Canada Type intends to digitize this dandy text face. See this MyFonts thread:  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/WhatTheFont/forum/viewthread.php?threadid=37115](http://web.archive.org/web/20071222005038/http:/www.myfonts.com/WhatTheFont/forum/viewthread.php?threadid=37115 "http://www.myfonts.com/WhatTheFont/forum/viewthread.php?threadid=37115")

Canada Type:  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/foundry/canadatype/](http://web.archive.org/web/20071222005038/http:/www.myfonts.com/foundry/canadatype/ "http://www.myfonts.com/foundry/canadatype/")
